case_name_cn: 门罗币隐私币追踪分析

heuristics.name: temporal_newest
heuristics.description: Newest input heuristic - assumes the most recent output in a ring is the real input

heuristics.name: temporal_age_dist
heuristics.description: Age distribution analysis - statistical anomalies in decoy selection patterns
heuristics.success_rate_historical: 70-80% on transactions with biased decoy selection

heuristics.name: chain_reaction
heuristics.description: Graph propagation when a transaction has only one plausible real input
heuristics.success_rate_historical: Variable, depends on initial seed confidence

heuristics.name: cross_chain
heuristics.description: Cross-chain analysis using hard fork information (e.g., MoneroV)

heuristics.name: external_intel
heuristics.description: Integration of external intelligence (exchange addresses, law enforcement tips)

limitations.recent_protocol_improvements: Ring size 11+ and improved decoy selection reduce traceability
limitations.data_type: Synthetic demonstration data for educational purposes

visualization_features: Confidence heat map across multiple heuristics

academic_references.title: A Traceability Analysis of Monero's Blockchain
An Empirical Analysis of Traceability in the Monero Blockchain

disclaimer: This is synthetic demonstration data created for educational and visualization purposes. Real Monero tracing requires sophisticated analysis, external intelligence, and often yields probabilistic rather than deterministic results. The effectiveness of these heuristics has decreased significantly with recent protocol upgrades.
